title: Elements of tempering, normalizing and annealing
creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.
creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
